newsitem.title: USA: PG&E hopes 1,212 MW hydro unit back soon.
newsitem.headline: PG&E hopes 1,212 MW hydro unit back soon.

text.p: Pacific Gas & Electric Co hopes to restart the 1,212 megawatt (MW) Helms pumped storage hydroelectric project soon, but a schedule has not been firmed up, a company spokeswoman said Monday.
The plant has been down since February 1 when a transformer bank for one of the projects three 404 MW reversible generators failed, causing a fire which damaged all three units.
Repair work is progressing, but operators "have not made a commitment to start-up," the spokeswoman said.
The Helms project, located near Fresno, Calif., operates as a "peaking" plant, producing power during daytime hours when power demand is generally highest.
During off-peak hours, the plant uses power to move water uphill, where it is released to flow downhill through power turbines during the day.
